Description:
Tradie haven with dual occ. potential.
Sale by SET DATE: Tues 27th August at 6pm (unless sold prior)
Positioned in an esteemed estate within easy access to shops, schools and public transport, this solid brick veneer home backs onto the serene Dorset Recreation Reserve and offers spacious family living with four generously sized bedrooms, as well as a rear wrap-around deck = and that's not all!
For starters, the home is set on a large 862m2 (approx.) block, boasting dual-occupancy potential (subject to council approval) and is located within General Residential Zone - Schedule 1 (GRZ1). The backyard is perfect for family recreation behind secure double gates where the property also boasts a double carport, in addition to an oversized double garage with high clearance and ample room for a workshop or storageideal for the tradie.
Step inside and experience instant warmth contributed by the use of polished floors throughout, combined with warm tones. The fireside lounge is the place to be during winter with a wood heater creating a relaxing ambience for socialising with loved ones.
The warmth of timber continues in the fully-equipped kitchen, featuring a Lofra (European) electric oven, gas stove, step-in cupboard and ample storage. The adjoining meals area is appreciably comfortable and boasts French doors opening up to a wrap-around deck leading to a covered sitting area.
The well proportioned, light-filled master comprises a double built-in robe while bedrooms two and three are also generously sized and robed. Bedroom four is huge and could easily be utilised as a living area, teen retreat or multi-purpose room.
The bathroom is bright, clean and functional, showcasing a beautiful claw foot bathtub ideal for soaking away the stress and cares of a busy day, in addition to a shower and separate toilet. Additional features of the home include; separate laundry, gas ducted heating, Roman blinds (lounge) and two sheds.
This property is positioned just a short stroll from Merrindale Shopping Centre, Tarralla Creek, Dorset Golf Course, Croydon Gums Kindergarten, Dorset Primary School, as well as being within close reach of Croydon Railway Station, Ruskin Park Primary School, Tintern Grammar, hospitals, bicycle track and EastLink freeway.
Croydon is currently undergoing major development growth with significant spending on local infrastructure that is likely to fuel property price and rental demand. One such project is the expansion of Croydon Central, introducing a new market food hall, new essential services, additional parking, upgraded children's play equipment, undercover walkway from Croydon Railway Station in addition to twenty new town terraces.
Suited to a variety of buyers, this delightful family home offers a promising future ahead.

Description:
'Sunnyview' A Piece Of Croydon History
Established at the turn of the century, Sunnyview is an exquisite piece of Croydon history. Prominently positioned, yet supremely private, the perfectly preserved homestead rests on a 1,592sqm (approx.) corner block; where colourful gardens, native birdlife and peering Mt Dandenong Ranges views form a stunning backdrop. Transporting you to a golden era where soaring 10ft ceilings, polished floorboards and open fireplaces grace nearly every room and delicate plaster features, lead light and sash windows inject character and light throughout, it is a picture of old world charm, that is perfectly suitable for today's growing families. Discover a sunny front sitting/bedroom and substantial size lounge both spilling out to a wrap-around verandah with beautiful garden aspects. A rear family/dining room leads into the kitchen; which boasts a large traditional layout with meals area that could easily be reconfigured to suit your cooking and storage requirements. Three bedrooms are complemented by a central bathroom with claw foot bath, shower and timber vanity - conveniently separated from the powder room and a second toilet. Adding further distinction, is the inclusion of gas ducted heating, split system air conditioning, a brick shed plus plenty of gated parking via Barclay Avenue. A superb location cements its lifestyle allure; accessing strip shops, the 737 bus stop, Dorset Primary School, Dorset Recreation Trail and Reserve on foot. Only minutes from Croydon's vibrant town centre with its boutique shops, eateries, recreational facilities and train station.
